articles.headline: As China Rises, Fears Grow on Whether Boom Can Endure
articles.snippet: A gradual flow of economic power from West to East has turned into a flood, but some wonder whether China’s rise is sustainable.
articles.abstract: A gradual flow of economic power from West to East has turned into a flood, but some wonder whether China’s rise is sustainable.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING  As much of the world struggles to clamber out of a serious recession, a gradual flow of economic power from West to East has turned into a flood.

articles.headline: Russian Dissident’s Passion Endures Despite Tests
articles.snippet: Lyudmila M. Alexeyeva, 82, provokes reverence, exasperation and the question of how a human rights movement will reshape itself when she is gone.
articles.abstract: Lyudmila M. Alexeyeva, 82, provokes reverence, exasperation and the question of how a human rights movement will reshape itself when she is gone.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW  You almost feel sorry for the police officer tasked with detaining Lyudmila M. Alexeyeva as she led an unsanctioned protest on New Year’s Eve. It is not just that at 82 years of age she appears as fragile as a porcelain teacup, or that she was dressed as a Snow Maiden, complete with sparkly hat and adorable fur muff.

articles.headline: A Future That Doesn’t Guzzle
articles.snippet: Automakers unveiled many hybrid gas-electric and battery-powered cars at the Detroit auto show, a sign of how much emphasis is being placed on the electrification of vehicles.
articles.abstract: Automakers unveiled many hybrid gas-electric and battery-powered cars at the Detroit auto show, a sign of how much emphasis is being placed on the electrification of vehicles.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  About 98 percent of the vehicles sold in the United States last year were powered by conventional gasoline engines, and hybrids occupied just a tiny niche.
articles.byline: By Bill Vlasic and Nick Bunkley

articles.headline: What the Financial Crisis Commission Should Ask
articles.snippet: Used correctly, the Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission hearing on Wednesday could steer current reform efforts.
articles.abstract: Used correctly, the Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission hearing on Wednesday could steer current reform efforts.

articles.headline: Cowell Says He Will Leave ‘Idol’
articles.snippet: The most popular judge on “American Idol” says his other projects do not leave him with enough time to continue with the show.
articles.abstract: The most popular judge on “American Idol” says his other projects do not leave him with enough time to continue with the show.
articles.lead_paragraph: PASADENA, Calif.  Simon Cowell, the acerbic British music producer whose caustic commentary as a judge on “American Idol” has guided the program to the top of the television ratings, announced on Monday that he would leave the program after this season to begin producing and judging a new talent competition, “The X Factor,” for the Fox network in the fall of 2011.

articles.headline: Low Profile for Chrysler After a Year of Change
articles.snippet: Sergio Marchionne, the carmaker’s chief executive, said that the company had to endure a fallow period before it could refresh its vehicle lineup.
articles.abstract: Sergio Marchionne, the carmaker’s chief executive, said that the company had to endure a fallow period before it could refresh its vehicle lineup.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  Chrysler always had a showman’s flair for grabbing attention at this city’s annual auto show. Its stunt highlight reel includes driving a Jeep through the front window of the convention center and dropping a pickup truck from its ceiling.

articles.headline: Now, Electronics That Obey Hand Gestures
articles.snippet: Devices will soon be sold that allow people to flip TV channels or move computer files with hand gestures.
articles.abstract: Devices will soon be sold that allow people to flip TV channels or move computer files with hand gestures.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS  The technology industry is going retro  moving away from remote controls, mice and joysticks to something that arrives without batteries, wires or a user manual.

articles.headline: Bank Is in Talks to Settle State Claims Over Merrill
articles.snippet: Bank of America is negotiating with the staff of the New York attorney general to settle claims that the bank failed to adequately disclose the risks of the takeover to its shareholders.
articles.abstract: Bank of America is negotiating with the staff of the New York attorney general to settle claims that the bank failed to adequately disclose the risks of the takeover to its shareholders.
articles.lead_paragraph: A year after its controversial takeover of Merrill Lynch, Bank of America is discussing settling a troublesome state inquiry into the star-crossed deal and the billions of dollars in bonuses that Merrill hurriedly paid its employees.
